The UN says the first aid delivery into the Gaza Strip via the Rafah border crossing should take place in the next day or so. Estimates suggest around one million people have been internally displaced in Gaza, including over 350,000 people staying in camps set up by the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees.

Russia has a lot to gain from it. The U.S. will be a little bit more distracted. There is a little bit of fatigue both in Europe and with the U.S. in terms of giving aid to Ukraine. We saw that there was already some withholding of aid from Warsaw. And if you look at the U.S., the Republicans, particularly the right-wing Republicans, they don't want to continue aiding Ukraine.
